title: Tourists in Russia leap from sightseeing boat that burst into flames

Tourists have spoken of the pandemonium that ensued after the sightseeing boat they were on burst into flames, forcing them to jump onto life rafts.
While meandering down Lake Baikal in Russia, an explosion on board the Barguzin 2 saw around 112 people leap for their lives onto rafts or wait to be plucked to safety by a passing yacht.
Passengers, which included locals and foreigners, reported smelling smoke on the vessel before it was engulfed by flames, while sailing near Peschanka.

'There was pandemonium, a mini-panic started, but when a yacht came alongside, everyone realised that they would be saved and calmed down.'
Mr Filippenko explained how there was no time for passengers to grab their belongings, and that passports, tickets and possessions were left to burn.

The Siberian Times reported that another passenger called Andrey wrote on his social media page: 'All of us rescued! Big thanks to the captain of the yacht 'Princess', who responded promptly!'
It is believed the crew were tested for alcohol in the aftermath of the incident, yet all results came back negative.
The Russian River Register are continuing their investigations.
The boat is being moored in Big Goloustnoye while these take place. It's thought to be unlikely that it will ever sail again.
